boardgame.name: Mexica
boardgame.description: Mexica plots the development of the city of Tenochtitlan on an island in lake Texcoco. Players attempt to partition it into districts, place buildings, and construct canals._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Districts are formed by completely surrounding areas of the island with water and then placing a District marker. The player who founds a district scores points immediately._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Canals and Lake Texcoco act as a quick method of moving throughout the city. Players erect bridges and move from one bridge to the next, which costs 1 action point regardless of the distance. They must also erect buildings. This costs action points, the exact number being dependent upon the building's size._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In the scoring phases of the game, players score points (El Grande style) based upon their dominance in a District. In the 4 player game, players with the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd most buildings score decreasing numbers of points._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Only districts are scored in the first scoring round._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In the second scoring round at the end of the game, all land areas are scored, not just districts._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The player with the most points wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Mexica is the third game in the Mask Trilogy._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

never played +++++ german version, but game parts are completely language independent and you can find rules translations on boardgamegeek +++++ will be shipped with insurance +++++ payment for usa, canada, asia or australia : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for other non-euro-countries : cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have euro : cash (by letter) or bank transfer (wich by the way is cost-free !) +++++ payment for germany : personal pick up in berlin or bank transfer +++++ foreign buyers beware : german postal sadly is very expensive for foreign packages (about 18 - 45 euros, it depends on, where the package has to be shipped and the weight), pleask at for shipping prices, before you buy !) +++++ shipping inside germany will cost 8 euros, including insurance

All our games are brand new in shrink wrap. Buyer pays for shipping. Shipping will depend on your location and the weight of game. Rio Grande Games - Mexica Language: English Players: 2 to 4 Age: 10+ Duration: about 60 to 75 min Weight: 1.570 kg New -- mint condition -- unopened -- still in shrink wrap. Theme: Mexica plots the development of the city of the same name on an island in lake Texcoco. Players attempt to partition it into districts, place buildings, and construct canals. Districts are formed by completely surrounding areas of the island with water and then placing a District marker. The player who founds a district scores points immediately. Canals and Lake Texcoco act as a quick method of moving throughout the city. Players erect bridges and move from one bridge to the next, which costs 1 action point regardless of the distance. They must also erect buildings. This costs action points, the exact number being dependent upon the building_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s size. In the scoring phases of the game, players score points (El Grande style) based upon their dominance in a District. In the 4 player game, players with the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd most buildings score decreasing numbers of points. Only districts are scored in the first scoring round. In the second scoring round at the end of the game, all land areas are scored, not just districts. The player with the most points wins. See Details (more info) or below for complete selling, payment and shipping conditions.

Rio Grande Games (RIO 192) Number of players: 2-4 Age of players: 10+ Length: 60-90 minutes Game Description: First the players explored Tikal, next they developed Java, and now they can help build Mexica. The Aztec prophesy foretold they would build their home where they found an eagle on a cactus eating a snake. After years of seraching they found their eagle on an island in lake Texcoco and there began building a city. Using dams and the natural landscape, they built a city with districts separated by roads of water and connected by many bridges.

Box is in mint condition. 100% Complete and components are in excellent condition. Shipping: Shipping rates are determined upon sale or by request. Insurance is optional. Combined shipping for multiple items. Payment: PayPal Return Policy: I will accept returns of any item for a refund of the purchase price within 30 days of the sale. I cannot refund the shipping cost. Please feel free to ask questions.
